Key Match Events: Jon Dagur Thorsteinsson scored for Iceland in the 16th minute.
Anthony Gordon missed a chance to equalize two minutes after Iceland's goal.
Harry Kane missed a golden chance in the 28th minute.
Thorsteinsson missed a chance to double Iceland's lead in the 63rd minute.
Aaron Ramsdale made a save from Sverrir Ingason's header and Kolbeinn Finnsson's volley.
Post-Match Reflections: England were booed off by some of their own fans after losing 1-0 to Iceland.
Gareth Southgate played down the severity of John Stones' injury, stating, 'We think he's probably OK but we didn't want to take a chance with that given what's coming up.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: England will face Serbia in their opening Group C match in Gelsenkirchen next Sunday.
Iceland did not qualify for the Euros, having been beaten by Ukraine in their playoff final in March.
